comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

see description at: https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/questions/827337
this is still broken as of 4.0.1.

firefox running, just sitting there, not the active window, app can be hidden or not (but most often it's hidden); start world of warcraft (cata, latest patches), and for the entire duration of time that wow is running, ff will be spamming the syslog on the order of 100 times or more per minute with messages such as:

Jun 18 15:38:36 crow [0x0-0x557557].org.mozilla.firefox[41129]: Sat Jun 18 15:38:36 crow.local firefox-bin[41129] <Error>: kCGErrorInvalidOperation: _CGSFindSharedWindow: WID 9184
Jun 18 15:38:47 crow firefox-bin[41129]: kCGErrorInvalidOperation: _CGSFindSharedWindow: WID 9184

notice that these always cleverly show up in groups of two, so there's no using the syslog "last message repeated x times" facility.  my syslog is like 60 megs now ... needless to say, these messages also make it way harder to find actually interesting stuff in the log.



Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. start firefox -- i have a few tabs open
2. start wow, play for a while
3. check /var/log/system.log

Actual Results:  
spam

Expected Results:  
no spam

add on list c&p'd from help menu:

Element Hiding Helper for Adblock Plus1.1.1trueelemhidehelper@adblockplus.orgFirefox Sync1.7true{340c2bbc-ce74-4362-90b5-7c26312808ef}Flashblock1.5.14.2false{3d7eb24f-2740-49df-8937-200b1cc08f8a}Web Developer1.1.9true{c45c406e-ab73-11d8-be73-000a95be3b12}JSView2.0.5true{cf15270e-cf08-4def-b4ea-6a5ac23f3bca}Status-4-Evar2011.04.06.18truestatus4evar@caligonstudios.comStylish1.1.2true{46551EC9-40F0-4e47-8E18-8E5CF550CFB8}Tree Style Tab0.11.2011050602truetreestyletab@piro.sakura.ne.jpBetterPrivacy1.51true{d40f5e7b-d2cf-4856-b441-cc613eeffbe3}Adblock Plus1.3.8true{d10d0bf8-f5b5-c8b4-a8b2-2b9879e08c5d}Greasemonkey0.9.5true{e4a8a97b-f2ed-450b-b12d-ee082ba24781}Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on0.9.3true{6d96bb5e-1175-4ebf-8ab5-5f56f1c79f65}NoScript2.1.1.2rc1true{73a6fe31-595d-460b-a920-fcc0f8843232}

sorry about the formatting
comments.author: gt400.59@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: This may be a duplicate of bug 642072.
comments.text: This may be a duplicate of bug 642072.
comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu

comments.text:
some additional info:  this behavior appears to possibly be related to a specific NSWindow method:

   - (void)setSharingType:(NSWindowSharingType)type

i have noticed over the past few days that firefox also spams the syslog in a similar way when one of my own programs is running.  i'm working on developing an image/movie-viewer-type application, and i was setting this to NSWindowSharingNone by default for each of the application's image/movie windows (this prevents other processes from accessing my app's window data, something they shouldn't need to be doing; this is just an additional security measure) ... 

i was thinking about it, because it was a recent change i had made, and didn't remember my app having a bad interaction w/ ff before ... sure enough, if i comment out that line in my code, ff no longer complains when my app is running.  now if you think about world of warcraft, this also makes perfect sense; they undoubtedly have that parameter set within the game because they're concerned about other apps being used as cheats/bots/etc.  that's probably why wow makes ff freak out like this.

now, that having been said, what the hell is going on inside firefox that it thinks it needs to be looking at every window of every application running on the system?  at the very least, that's a pretty fucked-up kludge.  i won't go so far as to attribute it to malice, but ...

(also cross-posting this comment to bug 642072).
comments.raw_text:
some additional info:  this behavior appears to possibly be related to a specific NSWindow method:

   - (void)setSharingType:(NSWindowSharingType)type

i have noticed over the past few days that firefox also spams the syslog in a similar way when one of my own programs is running.  i'm working on developing an image/movie-viewer-type application, and i was setting this to NSWindowSharingNone by default for each of the application's image/movie windows (this prevents other processes from accessing my app's window data, something they shouldn't need to be doing; this is just an additional security measure) ... 

i was thinking about it, because it was a recent change i had made, and didn't remember my app having a bad interaction w/ ff before ... sure enough, if i comment out that line in my code, ff no longer complains when my app is running.  now if you think about world of warcraft, this also makes perfect sense; they undoubtedly have that parameter set within the game because they're concerned about other apps being used as cheats/bots/etc.  that's probably why wow makes ff freak out like this.

now, that having been said, what the hell is going on inside firefox that it thinks it needs to be looking at every window of every application running on the system?  at the very least, that's a pretty fucked-up kludge.  i won't go so far as to attribute it to malice, but ...

(also cross-posting this comment to bug 642072).
